sentences: Karen Bernod (born May 13, 1964, Brooklyn, New York) is an American-born R&B vocalist, songwriter and producer.
Growing up in Brooklyn's Bed-Stuy, Bernod performed in neighborhood talent shows.
She majored in music at the State University of New York at New Paltz (SUNY) but took a leave of absence after one year to pursue her music career.
She is featured on three cuts No Time Like The Future: "Marrakech", "More Of Myself", and "Yesterday's Dream".
After touring Europe and America, Bernod returned home to Brooklyn and started production on her solo project.
Bernod's second CD, Life @ 360 Degrees, was released on the UK's Dome Records.
Everybody Dance – Japan release written by Karen Bernod and Robert Clivillés
1991: Just a Lil Bit of Love – written by Karen Bernod and Robert Clivillés
